item.itunes:title: Home Church Week 3: Gratitude
item.title: Home Church Week 3: Gratitude
item.itunes:summary: Ephesians 5:18-20 and Colossians 3:16-17 Reflection Guide What songs do you sing when you are grateful? What does Paul want us to know about thankfulness in these texts? How does Jesus make gratitude possible despite circumstances? Spend some time writing a prayer or psalm of gratitude. Would you be willing to share it on our MRC Facebook page? Spend some time memorizing Colossians 3:16-17
item.description:
Ephesians 5:18-20 and Colossians 3:16-17

Reflection Guide

What songs do you sing when you are grateful?

What does Paul want us to know about thankfulness in these texts?

How does Jesus make gratitude possible despite circumstances?

Spend some time writing a prayer or psalm of gratitude. Would you be willing to share it on our MRC Facebook page?  

Spend some time memorizing Colossians 3:16-17
item.content:encoded:
Ephesians 5:18-20 and Colossians 3:16-17

Reflection Guide

What songs do you sing when you are grateful?

What does Paul want us to know about thankfulness in these texts?

How does Jesus make gratitude possible despite circumstances?

Spend some time writing a prayer or psalm of gratitude. Would you be willing to share it on our MRC Facebook page?  

Spend some time memorizing Colossians 3:16-17
item.itunes:author: Pastor Michael De Ruyter

item.itunes:title: Home Church Week 2: Comfort & Identity
item.title: Home Church Week 2: Comfort & Identity
item.itunes:summary: Romans 1:20 and 8:28 1. What comforting masks, defense mechanisms, and coping devices are your most likely 'go-to' in times of high stress and uncertainty? What are the advantages of that source of comfort? What are the limitations? 2. How do you respond to the invitation to allow this challenging time to actually draw you closer to Jesus? 3. Describe a practice of belonging that is important to you right now. Make a plan to engage that practice today. 4...
item.description:
Romans 1:20 and 8:28

1.  What comforting masks, defense mechanisms, and coping devices are your most likely 'go-to' in times of high stress and uncertainty? What are the advantages of that source of comfort?  What are the limitations?

2.  How do you respond to the invitation to allow this challenging time to actually draw you closer to Jesus?  

3.   Describe a practice of belonging that is important to you right now.  Make a plan to engage that practice today.

4.    Where have you most clearly seen God's faithfulness and provision for you this week?

5.    In what ways are you personally being invited to partner with God in caring for others at this time?
item.content:encoded:
Romans 1:20 and 8:28

1.  What comforting masks, defense mechanisms, and coping devices are your most likely 'go-to' in times of high stress and uncertainty? What are the advantages of that source of comfort?  What are the limitations?

2.  How do you respond to the invitation to allow this challenging time to actually draw you closer to Jesus?  

3.   Describe a practice of belonging that is important to you right now.  Make a plan to engage that practice today.

4.    Where have you most clearly seen God's faithfulness and provision for you this week?

5.    In what ways are you personally being invited to partner with God in caring for others at this time?
item.itunes:author: Pastor Michael De Ruyter

item.itunes:title: Home Church Week 1: Glory to God
item.title: Home Church Week 1: Glory to God
item.itunes:summary: Sermon Scripture: Romans 11:33-12:1 Reflection questions 1. Romans invites us to consider the question, “To whom do we give our worship?” For Paul, the answer is of critical importance. What does it mean to give all of yourself to God in worship? How can you practice that this week? 2. What are some of the differences between God’s sovereign reign and the roman empire that we outlined in this study? Why is it important to keep some of Paul’s political situation in view as we study Roman...
item.description:
Sermon Scripture:  Romans 11:33-12:1

Reflection questions

1. Romans invites us to consider the question, “To whom do we give our worship?” For Paul, the answer is of critical importance. What does it mean to give all of yourself to God in worship? How can you practice that this week?

2. What are some of the differences between God’s sovereign reign and the roman empire that we outlined in this study? Why is it important to keep some of Paul’s political situation in view as we study Romans?  

3. In what ways do you find yourself tempted to give glory to another kingdom (empire) than God’s? This may take some deep, honest reflection, but Paul thinks we are all complicit in this (see for example, 3:9-11 and 6.16)

4. We end where we began. Spend some time reflecting (or maybe even journaling and certainly praying) about the ways you are comforted today by a God who is wonderful, good, wise, powerful and gracious. Never an excuse to practice injustice or to be unloving, but rather the very foundation of our lives of justice and love, God is in Control! Amen!
item.content:encoded:
Sermon Scripture:  Romans 11:33-12:1

Reflection questions

1. Romans invites us to consider the question, “To whom do we give our worship?” For Paul, the answer is of critical importance. What does it mean to give all of yourself to God in worship? How can you practice that this week?

2. What are some of the differences between God’s sovereign reign and the roman empire that we outlined in this study? Why is it important to keep some of Paul’s political situation in view as we study Romans?  

3. In what ways do you find yourself tempted to give glory to another kingdom (empire) than God’s? This may take some deep, honest reflection, but Paul thinks we are all complicit in this (see for example, 3:9-11 and 6.16)

4. We end where we began. Spend some time reflecting (or maybe even journaling and certainly praying) about the ways you are comforted today by a God who is wonderful, good, wise, powerful and gracious. Never an excuse to practice injustice or to be unloving, but rather the very foundation of our lives of justice and love, God is in Control! Amen!
